Modification_Detail.description: Edited to comply with Editorial Working Group checklist. Added missing DOIs for references.
Extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model
Custom update by K. Lopez (SBN) to improve information and metadata.

External_Reference.reference_text: Beichman, C.A., G. Neugebauer, H.J. Habing, P.E. Clegg, and T.J. Chester, 1988, Infrared Astronomical Satellite Catalog and Atlases, Volume 1, Explanatory Supplement, NASA RP-1190.

Neugebauer, G., H.J. Habing, R. van Duinen, H.H. Aumann, B. Baud, C.A. Beichman, D.A. Beintema, N. Boggess, P.E. Clegg, T. de Jong, J.P. Emerson, T.N. Gautier, F.C. Gillett, S. Harris, M.G. Hauser, J.R. Houck, R.E. Jennings, F.J. Low, P.L. Marsden, G. Miley, F.M. Olnon, S.R. Pottasch, E. Raimond, M. Rowan-Robinson, B.T. Soifer, R.G. Walker, P.R. Wesselius, and E. Young, The Infrared Astronomical Satellite (IRAS) Mission, Astrophysica Journal 278, L1-L6, 1984.

Rowan-Robinson, M., P.E. Clegg, C.A. Beichman, G. Neugebauer, B.T. Soifer, H.H. Aumann, D.A. Beintema, N. Boggess, J.P. Emerson, T.N. Gautier, F.C. Gillett, M.G. Hauser, J.R. Houck, F.J. Low, and R.G. Walker, 1984, The IRAS minisurvey, AJ, 278, L7-L10.

Investigation.name: Infrared Astronomical Satellite
Investigation.description: The IRAS mission was a joint program of the USA, the Netherlands, and the UK to conduct a survey of the sky in four IR wavelengths. It also made pointed observatons of selected astronomical and solar system objects.
